original_solution_mapping.L2: It will take 4*2=<<4*2=8>>8 more hours to bake each one.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2719.
    Returns: the total hours it will take to make all of the bread.
    """
    # L1
    num_balls_dough = 4 # 4 balls of dough
    rise_time_per_ball = 3 # 3 hours to rise 1 ball of dough
    total_rise_time = num_balls_dough * rise_time_per_ball

    # L2
    bake_time_per_ball = 2 # another 2 hours to bake it
    total_bake_time = num_balls_dough * bake_time_per_ball

    # L3
    total_time = total_rise_time + total_bake_time

    # FA
    answer = total_time
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Ellen takes {num_balls_dough}*{rise_time_per_ball}=<<{num_balls_dough}*{rise_time_per_ball}={total_rise_time}>>{total_rise_time} hours in total to rise all balls of dough.
It will take {num_balls_dough}*{bake_time_per_ball}=<<{num_balls_dough}*{bake_time_per_ball}={total_bake_time}>>{total_bake_time} more hours to bake each one.
It will take her {total_rise_time}+{total_bake_time}=<<{total_rise_time}+{total_bake_time}={total_time}>>{total_time} hours to make all of the bread.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Ellen takes 4*3=<<4*3=12>>12 hours in total to rise all balls of dough.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: It will take 4*2=<<4*2=8>>8 more hours to bake each one.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: It will take her 12+8=<<12+8=96>>96 hours to make all of the bread.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '*' instead.
